page.title: 05Plant life by the River Tone
page.content:
{Trees.} I saw many willow trees, they droop down nearly to the ground, and two types of ivy. They climb up the trees, winding around the trunk. A hawthorn tree with its spiky prickles and an alder tree after which Allerford - originally Alderford - was named.
{Flowers.} Rosebay willowherbs are tall flowers with pink petals. Dandelions were seeding. Clover was growing in amongst the grass where celandines were just poking through with their yellow flowers. Blackberries were just ripening in the hedgerows,amongst teasels with their prickly pods. Greater Burdock with its sticky pods stuck to our legs while the nettles stung. Rowan with its poisonous berries stood out brightly.
